name: Comm Officer Stepinac

topics.response_text: {Player in NCR gear}Hey there. Is McCarran having you check up on us?
All quiet at the moment. Ranger{BOH-mont}Beaumont is in charge here, but he's off leading a patrol.

topics.topic_text: I've brought new security codes for this station's radio from Sergeant Reyes.
topics.response_text: Simple enough to change. I doubt the Legion's listening in on us - they're not that sophisticated - but better safe than sorry, right?
Radio signal out here can be pretty spotty because of all the hills. Sometimes our scheduled updates don't go through.
Ranger Station Charlie. We're responsible for keeping the highway up through Novac civilized.

topics.topic_text: Mind if I take some of those extra medical supplies?
topics.response_text: {NCR - Devil}Something tells me this isn't the first time you've done things that the NCR would find... objectionable.
We're part scout, part commando, part sheriff. The training is brutal, and I'd say eight out of ten recruits washes out before the end.

topics.topic_text: Are there a lot of Rangers in the Mojave?
topics.response_text: Couple dozen, I'd say, most of them posted at stations like this one. We either man the station or patrol the immediate area.

topics.topic_text: How does someone become a Ranger?
topics.response_text: The Rangers mostly draw from the basic NCR army. A trooper who shows exceptional skill at fighting and scouting can be nominated for the training.

description:
Stepinac is a 58 year-old Caucasian Male.

A seasoned NCR Ranger Communications Officer currently in charge of Ranger Station Charlie while Commander Beaumont is away on patrol. Stepinac is vigilant about the station's supplies, particularly the excess medicine and first aid equipment recently received.

Stepinac's Personality: Disciplined, methodical, and fiercely loyal to the NCR hierarchy. Stepinac is cautious about involving civilians in military matters and prefers to follow established protocols rather than take initiative.

Stepinac's Backstory: Born in the NCR-controlled territory before the annexation of New Vegas, Stepinac enlisted in the Rangers in his early twenties. After showing aptitude for communications and maintaining equipment, he was assigned as a Communications Officer. Over three decades of service, he's developed a reputation for reliability and strict adherence to orders. His Croatian surname is a legacy from his great-grandparents who immigrated to California before the Great War.
